One more thing on the folding wings : if you fold them mid-air IRL, they would be ripped apart, right ? So, in your folding system, you should include something like this :


override OnGetKeyDown('yourFoldingKey')
{
//Do your folding system here
set drag = 99999
set breakingForce = 1
set breakingTorque = 1
}

If folded on ground on in space, no problem. But in flight, the huge drag created combined with the low breaking force and torque, will rip the wings...
Well, it depends on the way they fold, some folding wings work perfectly well in flight.

? ? ? What aircraft does fold wings in flight ?

Well, my only example is the IL-2 series, where the Corsair and all other carrier planes doesn\'t like folding them in air...

I can\'t remember what plane it was, but its wings rotated 90Âº before it achieved supersonic velocities to minimize drag. Also, SpaceShip One\'s wings folded after it was slowed down in the atmosphere.

Rotating 90Â°, don\'t you mean Variable Geometry Wings ? \'cause some aircrafts like the Rockwell B1-B rotates their wings in flight.

About SpaceShipOne, i don\'t know exactly...

Yeah, i think it depends on the folding system... The WW2 planes were in metal+tissue, and they weren\'t originally intended to fold their wings.
Yeah, a WW2 plane would definitely fall apart if it had folding wings in flight. But I\'m pretty sure a plane that\'s designed to do it would have no trouble at all.
